title: Cell Based Assays of SINEUP Non-coding RNAs That Can Specifically Enhance mRNA Translation
procedures:
1. Design of BDs of SINEUP Constructs for Target mRNAs
Check transcription starting site (TSS) and translation starting site of target mRNAs in the cells of interest. Acquire TSS data from both the ENCODE and FANTOM projects (cap analysis of gene expression, CAGE) (ZENBU: http://fantom.gsc.riken.jp/zenbu/).
Open the browser, search genes of interest and check TSS by CAGE peaks.
Consult the example analysis of cell and tissue specific TSS of Parkinson disease protein 7 (PARK7) mRNA shown in Figure 2.
Design BD sequences of several different lengths corresponding to 40 bases upstream and 32 bases downstream of the first methionine (AUG), 72 nt in total.
Custom order the designed BDs in SINEUP expression vector (see Table of Materials).
NOTE: Check the sequence specificity by basic local alignment search tool (BLAST) to avoid off-target effects26.
2. Cell Culture and SINEUP Transfection
Seed cells of interest in a 6 well-plate or 24 well-plate for 24 h before transfection of SINEUPs. In the case of human embryonic kidney cell line (HEK293T/17) (see Table of Materials), seed 0.5 x 106 cells per well of a 6 well-plate or 1.5 x 105 cells per well of a poly-D-lysine coated 24 well-plate (see Table of Materials). It becomes 70% confluent after 24 h.

After 24 h, change the medium to 1.5 mL of fresh medium for a 6 well-plate or 0.4 mL of fresh medium for a 24 well-plate. In case of SINEUP-GFP, transfect 0.6 µg of pEGFP-C2 (see Table of Materials) and 3.4 µg of SINEUP-GFP in one well of a 6 well-plate or 130 ng of pEGFP-C2 and 670 ng of SINEUP-GFP in one well of a 24 well-plate with transfection reagent (10 µL in 6 well-plate and 3 µL in 24 well-plate) by following the manufacturer’s instructions (see Table of Materials), and incubate at 37 °C in a 5% CO2 incubator for 24 h.
Wash cells with 2 mL of phosphate buffer saline (PBS) (37 mM NaCl, 8 mM Na2HPO4, 2.6 mM KCl and 1.5 mM KH2PO4) in each well of a 6 well-plate or 0.5 mL of PBS in each well of a 24 well-plate. Only for poly-D-lysine coated 24 well-plate, add 25 µL of 0.05% weight per volume Trypsin, incubate in a 5% CO2 incubator for 5 min and add 275 µL of cell medium per well. In case of 6 well-plate, add 2 mL of PBS in each well. Pipet up and down to harvest 3/4 of cells (1.5 mL for a 6 well-plate or 225 µL for a 24 well-plate) from 1 well for protein extraction (go to protocol 3 for protein extraction) and 1/4 of cells (0.5 mL for a 6 well-plate or 75 µL for a 24 well-plate) for RNA extraction and  centrifuge at 6,000 x g for 5 min at 4 °C (go to step 5 for RNA extraction).
NOTE: Analyze the effect of SINEUP-GFP in a poly-D-lysine coated 24 well-plate by imaging. Go to step 7 (imaging analysis).
3. Protein Extraction

Carefully aspirate 1.5 mL of PBS and add 140 µL of lysis solution (20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 150 mM NaCl, 1 mM Na2EDTA, 1 mM EGTA, 1% (w/v) Triton, 2.5 mM sodium pyrophosphate, 1 mM β-glycerophosphate, 1 mM Na3VO4, 1 μg/mL leupeptin, and 0.005% (w/v) phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (PMSF)) (see Table of Materials) for a 6 well-plate or 60 µL for a 24 well-plate to the cell pellets.
Mix by pipetting and then mix thoroughly by rotating at slow speed for 1 h at 4 °C. Collect supernatant by centrifugation at 14,000 x g for 10 min at 4 °C.
Check protein concentration by colorimetric assay (see Table of Materials). Prepare all the reactions at room temperature.
Prepare 5-6 times dilution of bovine serum albumin (BSA) protein standard in ultrapure water with concentrations ranging from 0.2-1.5 mg/mL protein. Prepare fresh standards each time.
Prepare working reagent Aʹ by mixing 1 mL of reagent A (alkaline copper tartrate solution) with 20 µL of reagent S (surfactant solution).
Load 5 µL of water (negative control), BSA standard (protein standard and positive control) or protein sample in each well of a 96-well-plate.
Add 25 µL of reagent Aʹ in each well. Carefully add 200 µL of reagent B (Folin reagent) per well avoiding any bubble formation. Cover the plate with aluminum foil and wait for 5-10 min.
Measure the protein absorbance at 750 nm with a spectrophotometer. The absorbance is stable for at least 1 h.
Prepare standard curve by plotting BSA standard protein concentrations (mg/mL) on the x-axis and their respective absorbance on the y-axis. Calculate sample protein concentration by applying standard curve equation.

NOTE: Pause the protocol at this step if needed or go to step 4. For long-term storage, snap freeze protein samples in liquid nitrogen and store at -80 °C.
4. Protein Separation by SDS-PAGE and Detection of Target Proteins with Antibodies (Western-blot Analysis)
Add one volume of 2x loading dye (0.1 M Tris-HCl (pH 6.8), 4% SDS, 20% glycerol, 1.42% 2-mercaptethanol and 0.2% bromophenol blue) to each volume of protein sample from step 3.3. Heat at 90 °C for 5 min and immediately cool on ice for 1 min.
Load 10-20 µg of protein samples to 10% SDS poly-acrylamide gel and separate at 100-150 V) (see Table of Materials).
Transfer protein from gel to 0.45-µm nitrocellulose membrane (see Table of Materials) by semi-dry transfer instrument with transfer buffer (25 mM Tris, 192 mM glycine and 20% methanol) at 25 V for 30 min.
Add blocking solution (5% non-fat dry milk in 1x TBST buffer (137 mM NaCl, 20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.6), 0.1% Tween-20)) (see Table of Materials) to the container until the membrane is completely soaked and incubate it at room temperature for 30 min.
In the case of SINEUP-GFP, hybridize the protein with anti-GFP antibody (diluted 1:2000 in blocking solution) (see Table of Materials) by incubating the membrane for 30 min with shaking at room temperature. As an internal control protein, detect β-actin protein by hybridizing with Anti-β-Actin antibody (diluted 1:2000 in blocking solution) (see Table of Materials) for 30 min with shaking at room temperature.
Add 1x TBST buffer to the container until the membrane is completely soaked and wash for 5 min at room temperature. Repeat the wash step two more times (a total of three washes).

Hybridize GFP protein to diluted (1:1000 in blocking solution) anti-rabbit antibody conjugated with horseradish peroxidase (HRP), and hybridize β-actin protein to diluted (1:1000 in blocking solution) anti-mouse antibody conjugated with HRP on the membrane for 30 min with shaking at room temperature.
Wash membrane with 1x TBST buffer for 5 min at room temperature. Repeat the wash step two more times (a total of three washes).
Mix equal volume of HRP-enhanced chemiluminescence (ECL) detection reagent 1 and 2 (see Table of Materials). Transfer the membrane to 2 mL ECL reagent mix, cover the box with aluminum foil and let it incubate for 1-2 min at room temperature. Carefully remove the membrane from ECL reagent mix and expose using a luminescence imaging instrument.
5. RNA Extraction and DNase Treatment
Extract total RNA following the standard protocol for RNA extraction from cells grown in a monolayer27 or alternatively use a commercially available RNA extraction kit (see Table of Materials). To state in brief, add any monophasic lysis reagent (MLR) of guanidine isothiocyanate and phenol to the harvested cells in step 2.3 (1 mL MLR per ~5 million cells)27.
NOTE: Change gloves frequently. Use RNase-free reagents, and diethylpyrocarbonate (DEPC)-treated plastic ware and glassware to prevent RNA degradation. Pause the protocol at this step if needed. Store extracted RNA at -80 °C.
Add 0.1 volume of 10x DNase buffer and 2 U of DNase to the purified RNA from step 5.1 (see Table of Materials).
Set the reaction volume to 50 µL with nuclease-free water and mix gently. Incubate at 37 °C for 30 min.
Add 0.1 volume of re-suspended DNase inactivation reagent and mix well (see Table of Materials). Incubate for 5 min at room temperature with gentle shaking.

Centrifuge at 10,000 x g for 90 s. Transfer the supernatant (DNA-free RNA) to a fresh RNase-free 1.5 mL tube. Be careful not to touch the pellet because this can cause carry-over of DNase which is troublesome for downstream steps.
Quantitate RNA by measuring A260 and A260/A280 ratio (for pure RNA, the range is 1.8-2.0) in a UV spectrophotometer.
6. First Strand cDNA Synthesis and qRT-PCR Analysis
Perform first strand cDNA synthesis following a standard cDNA synthesis protocol as below (see Table of Materials).
Mix 0.75 µM oligo dT primer, 4.3 µM random primer, dNTPs (10 mM each) with 200-500 ng total RNA (from steps 5-8) in 10 µL of total reaction volume. Incubate at 65 °C for 5 min and then immediately put on ice.
Mix 1x reverse transcriptase buffer, 1 U of RNase inhibitor, 10 U of reverse transcriptase, and add to 10 µL RNA-primer mix from 6.1.1.
Set the total reaction volume to 20 µL with nuclease-free water if required. Mix gently and incubate the reaction mix at 30 °C for 10 min, then at 42 °C for 60 min, and finally at 95 °C for 5 min to inactivate the enzyme. Cool the tubes on ice.
NOTE: Thaw RNA samples and all the reagents on ice and prepare the reaction mix on ice. If target RNAs are only polyA RNAs, use oligo dT primer only (2.5 µM). Pause the protocol if needed. Store synthesized cDNA at -20 °C.

Perform qRT-PCR in technical triplicates (n=3, Cт standard deviation > 0.2) and within biological replicates (n ≥ 3) using 1 µL of 10 ng cDNA, 0.4 µL of reverse primer (10 µM), 0.4 µL of forward primer (10 µM), 10 µL of mixture solution of DNA polymerase, 0.4 µL of double-strand DNA staining dye, 10 µL of nuclease-free water (reaction volume was 20 µL) to detect PCR products using following conditions; hold stage (1 cycle) for 30 s at 95 °C, cycling stage (40 cycles) for 5 s at 95 °C and for 30 s at 60 °C, melt curve stage. Primer examples are for Human Gapdh_Fw: TCTCTGCTCCTCCTGTTC, Human Gapdh_Rv: GCCCAATACGACCAAATCC, EGFP_Fw: GCCCGACAACCACTACCTGAG, EGFP_Rv: CGGCGGTCACGAACTCCAG, SINEUP-GFP_Fw: CTGGTGTGTATTATCTCTTATG and SINEUP-GFP_Rv: CTCCCGAGTCTCTGTAGC. See Table of Materials. Analyze quantitative RNA expression with 2-∆∆Ct ± SD method28.
7. Imaging Analysis of SINEUPs by Semi-automated Detection Method
Wash cells with 0.5 mL of PBS for one well of a 24 well-plate.
Add 2.0 μg of Hoechst 33342 (see Table of Materials) (dissolving in 500 μL of PBS) to each well of the 24-well-plate and incubate cells at 37 °C for 20 min to stain the nucleus.
Measure Hoechst stained cells to count the total number of cells at a blue emission maximum of 461 nm, and intensity of green fluorescence to count number of GFP positive cells at a green emission maximum of 510 nm by using a high-throughput micro-well image cytometer (see Table of Materials). Analyze protein up-regulatory effect of the SINEUPs by calculating GFP integrated intensity, which is the sum of all pixel intensities displaying signal in segmented objects calculated for each channel, using Imaging software29.
Harvest cells to check RNA expression (back to steps 5 and 6).
